35.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
35.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
Or heneken hen'-ek-en or heineken hi'-nek-en; of uncertain affinity; on account of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.

35.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
35.str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.

35.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
35.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

36.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
36.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

36.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
36.str2: To help, benefit, do good, be useful (to), profit. From the same as opheleia; to be useful, i.e. To benefit.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
To gain, acquire, win (over), avoid loss. From kerdos; to gain.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
From zemia; to injure, i.e. to experience detriment.

36.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
36.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.

37.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

37.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
37.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

37.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
37.str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
An exchange, purchasing price. From a compound of anti and allasso; an equivalent or ransom.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

37.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
37.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.

38.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

38.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
38.str2: Who, which, what, that.

38.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
38.str2: To be ashamed, be ashamed of. From epi and aischunomai; to feel shame for something.

38.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
38.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
And, even, also, namely.

38.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 1st Person Plural
38.str2: My, mine. From the oblique cases of ego; my.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
This; he, she, it.
A prolonged form of the feminine of moichos; an adulteress.
And, even, also, namely.
Sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable. From hamartano; sinful, i.e. A sinner.
From genos; a generation; by implication, an age.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

38.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
38.str2: To be ashamed, be ashamed of. From epi and aischunomai; to feel shame for something.

38.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
38.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

38.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
38.str2: To come, go.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

38.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
38.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
